726143f-a.title: Queens: Beach 20th Street - Seagirt Avenue
726143f-a.text:
Beach 20th Street, west side, between Seagirt Ave., and Plainview
Ave., showing the property of D.H. McCabe in 1873.
January 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
726143f-a.folder: Beach 20th Street & Seagirt Avenue, Queens, NY

726145f-a.title: Queens: Beach 20th Street - Seagirt Avenue
726145f-a.text:
Beach 20th Street, west side, between Seagirt and Plainview Aves.
This is a set of three views of the kitchen of the Marine Pavilion Hotel
modernized. H. Bainbridge was the owner in 1873 (7) and F. N. Faber in
1891. The Marine Favilion stood on the west side of Turnpike Road (later
Shell Road), south of the junction of Norton Street (now Plainfield Ave.)
and Central Ave. (now Beach 20th Street) and occupied most of that block
between Plainfield Avenue and Broadway; the Ocean coming to the foot of
the lawn. This structure, built in 1832-33 was destroyed by fire on June
25, 1864. It stood on the site of the home of Richard Cornell, who came
to Far Rockaway in 1685 and died there in 1694. The Rockawav and Jamaica
Turnpike Road (Shell Road later and now Beach 19th Street) was constructed
in 1834; from Brooklyn to this point, and on this Road stage coaches weee
regularly run.
January 1923.
Views 1 \& 2.
View 3: October 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
726145f-a.folder: Beach 20th Street & Seagirt Avenue, Queens, NY
